title: Business & Finance
text:
A rally in technology shares helped the stock market snap a three-week losing streak, but there are already signs that reprieve may be short-lived.

---

Another turbulent week in oil markets carried petroleum prices to their lowest point since January.

---

Nikola founder Trevor Milton faces a securities-fraud trial beginning this week on allegations that he lied about his electric-truck maker's development of environmentally friendly technology.

---

Apple's new emergency-text feature on its latest iPhone models makes it a first-mover in a budding market for low-cost satellite phone connections.

---

Visa, Mastercard and American Express will add a new merchant category for firearms retailers, a victory for gun-control advocates who have pressed the financial industry to do more to help curb mass shootings.

---

High temperatures in the Western U.S. are hitting the produce industry, damaging crops, shrinking shipments and leaving fewer greens and fruits on market shelves.

---

Illness caused by Covid-19 shrank the U.S. labor force by around 500,000 people, according to new study.
